oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Liberace at the Belle Meade Country Club, 1953
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Liberace, a famous American pianist and vocalist, posing with Nashville Mayor Ben West and others, at the Belle Meade Country Club in 1953. A famous and flamboyant entertainer (born as Wladziu Valentino Liberace), he was the highest-paid entertainer in the world during the 1950s-1970s. Belle Meade Country Club was founded in 1901, and located approximately 9 miles from downtown Nashville in Belle Meade, a city in Davidson County, Tennessee. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 9 photograph negatives : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Liberace, 1919-1987; West, Ben, 1911-1974
